summary.para: Retrieves the source geometry of this transformed geometry object.

param.name: sourceGeometry
param.para: When this method returns, contains a pointer to a pointer to the source geometry for this transformed geometry object. This parameter is passed uninitialized.

summary.para: Retrieves the matrix used to transform the object's source geometry.

param.name: transform
param.para: A pointer that receives the matrix used to transform the object's source geometry. You must allocate storage for this parameter.

summary.para: Represents a geometry that has been transformed.

remarks.para: Using an ID2D1TransformedGeometry rather than transforming a geometry by using a render target's transform enables you to transform a geometry without transforming its stroke.
To create an ID2D1TransformedGeometry, call the method.

Direct2D geometries are immutable and device-independent resources created by . In general, you should create geometries once and retain them for the life of the application, or until they need to be modified. For more information about device-independent and device-dependent resources, see the Resources Overview.
